DOC.brief_summary: To determine whether higher as compared with lower maintenance doses of clopidogrel can adequately improve the degree of platelet inhibition in carriers of a reduced-function CYP2C19 allele.
DOC.brief_title: Escalating Clopidogrel by Involving a Genetic Strategy - Thrombolysis In Myocardial Infarction 56
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria (major): 1. Between 18 and 75 years of age, inclusive. 2. Have an indication for the use of clopidogrel defined as either spontaneous MI [hospitalized with final diagnosis of MI, excluding periprocedural or definite secondary MI (e.g., due to anemia or hypertensive emergency)] or PCI within the past 6 months. 3. Clinically stable and at least 4 weeks following the MI or PCI. Exclusion Criteria (major): 1. Conditions that alter platelet function. 2. Conditions that increase bleeding risk.
